messages: 76758080d9c8cc3daa811e8d328be4f8 (14:27): trying to debug blender with gdb, but it only throws arithmetic exception when I start it
cc414b005b051e1793cf1b9d724e9684 (14:31): is someone working with cvs version and is familiar with drivers ?

2ddfea883dd4e8de5d2a8e22fe82e9fe (14:36): yesterday, I had the problem that an animation following a path started at the wrong end of the path - I was told to reverse the time IPO for the path - this worked fine, until I rendered with motion blur, which is the wrong way round now. How to fix this?
4e034d79f6fd38d71ee4b49748485a3e (14:37): juste SElect Path, Edit and Wkey ;)
2ddfea883dd4e8de5d2a8e22fe82e9fe (14:47): it shows future frames instead of past
4e034d79f6fd38d71ee4b49748485a3e (14:48): have a pict of that dang`r`us ?
4e034d79f6fd38d71ee4b49748485a3e (14:55): hmmm there is no solution i think, MBlur 'sux' in Blender
2ddfea883dd4e8de5d2a8e22fe82e9fe (14:56): colleague just suggested I render from (end frame) to (start frame) :D
2ef721b06e97dfc7422d2cb6d633b405 (14:58): how can i close an object .. like a sphere, where i deleted some vertices?
4e034d79f6fd38d71ee4b49748485a3e (14:59): select the border (shift+alt+ctrl+m) and shift+f (alt+f alt+j
4e034d79f6fd38d71ee4b49748485a3e (14:59): the better way is select and Extrude SizeDown
2ef721b06e97dfc7422d2cb6d633b405 (15:07): i just select the border and press Shift + f
2ddfea883dd4e8de5d2a8e22fe82e9fe (15:07): okay, I think http://blenderfrance.free.fr/python/LocalBlur_en.htm is good for my purpose
4e034d79f6fd38d71ee4b49748485a3e (15:07): yes, alt+f to got a better issue and alt+j for Tri to Quad
2ef721b06e97dfc7422d2cb6d633b405 (15:09): another thing .. now i want to add a parent object to another object ...
2ef721b06e97dfc7422d2cb6d633b405 (15:10): so its moved along with the parent in an animation
4e034d79f6fd38d71ee4b49748485a3e (15:10): select childs and shift+RMB the parent and ctrl+P
2ddfea883dd4e8de5d2a8e22fe82e9fe (15:11): it does not work for path animations
2ef721b06e97dfc7422d2cb6d633b405 (15:13): thx .. its the animation from the gus tutorial
2ef721b06e97dfc7422d2cb6d633b405 (15:13): the figure is not animated along a path
